channel.title: Just a few questions regarding aesthetics
channel.description: All problems solved with the new understanding of the sendQuest command. I appreciate any and all help that was given.

item.title: Just a few questions regarding aesthetics
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

shaden:

Or are you saying that I find the frame ID and such and force the server to send text to the given tab? If this is the case, would you happen to know any methods of finding the frame/line ID?

Yeah, you should be able to find the interface ID, by looking at an ID list, or find the ID in the login method where the server send the interfaces upon login. After that you will just need to figure out the line ID’s, you can do this by simple trial and error.

Read full topic
item.source: Just a few questions regarding aesthetics

item.title: Just a few questions regarding aesthetics
item.dc:creator: @shaden shaden
item.description:
@shaden wrote:

I’ve found the interface ID in clickingMost.java, however the only code shown is the part that sets the case, has a note that describes it, and a number which determines the animation. Would I have better luck looking into a different folder? If so, what direction might you point me in?

Or are you saying that I find the frame ID and such and force the server to send text to the given tab? If this is the case, would you happen to know any methods of finding the frame/line ID?

I do apologize for my ignorance, however, it has just been a few years since I have worked with private servers.

Read full topic
item.source: Just a few questions regarding aesthetics

item.title: Just a few questions regarding aesthetics
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

    • You will just need to find the interface ID, and line ID and then change the text with the sendQuest or similar method, which sends a packet to the client with the new text.
    • This is done the same as the above, you just need to add ‘@yel@’ tag to change the colour of the text.
    • You will need to edit the interface itself. This means decompiling the cache, editing the interface and then adding it back to the cache.
    • I think these two questions require editing the interface as well, since the magic tab interface is built into the cache. I could be wrong, but this is the way that I see it.
    • You can remove the quest name, the same was as in the first question, just use the sendQuest or similar command to send a new tab text upon login.

Read full topic
item.source: Just a few questions regarding aesthetics
